resource.chars:
The centre wh: receives most of them is however 
the <u>thalamus opticus: <s>but <\s> the caudate nucleus however 
also appears to receive a few - but only a few - in 
the brain of Man. I question if the <u>lenticular 
nucleus <\u> has any such connection with the 
cortical fibres. [The direct motor fibres wh: pass 
through the inner capsule from below, and wh:
become connected to the motor area above on 
the same side, have decussated as before said in 
the anterior pyramids. I think I can point out 
the band in many of my preparations. It is 
of small bulk. With this exception I can find 
<u>no fibres wh: run directly up from the inner 
capsule to the cortex of the same side.<\u> Hence I hold 
that the “corona radiata “ does not exist. The fibres 
wh:, on superficial examination, <u>appear <\u> to 
run directly up to the cortex, in reality, do not 
do so, but cross in the corpus callosum.
Continue
